definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: They have now endured seven defeats in all competitions and there are a lot of stiff challenges still.
sentences.chinese: 他们在各项赛事中已输掉七场，而硬仗还数不胜数。

sentences.english: Nature is full of color temperature examples.
sentences.chinese: 大自然是色温的例子数不胜数。

sentences.english: Predictions of just such a switch have been made countless times over the years.
sentences.chinese: 这种转变的预言多年来发生的次数数不胜数。
这样的欺诈行为数不胜数。

sentences.english: There are a lot of fantastic audiobooks out there.
sentences.chinese: 绝妙的有声书数不胜数。

sentences.english: There have been many proposals, but all share two features.
sentences.chinese: 提案已然数不胜数，但总归有两个共同点。

sentences.english: In Silicon Valley, copyright and patent infringement suits are a dime a dozen.
sentences.chinese: 在硅谷，侵犯版权和专利诉讼案件数不胜数。

sentences.english: There are endless possibilities on how you could configure your managed system.
sentences.chinese: 您能如何配置所管理的系统的可能性数不胜数。

definition: lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
as many as the hair of the ox (idiom)/great amount of/countless
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
lit. so numerous that one could just bend down and pick them up (idiom)/fig. extremely common/easily available
